pull_request.title: Disable tests compilation by default. New 'make tests' target.

update.description:
The idea comes from @jlee02 explained in [a different pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2489/disable-tests-compilation-by-default-in/diff#comment-26266415). I'm point this change to default instead of gazebo7, seems pretty intrusive for me to include in a minor bump.

Remove the cmake `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` parameter and exclude all tests compilation from `make all` so a simple `make` call won't compile any single test file. 

The whole test suite can be compiled by running `make tests`. All the individual tests make targets are generated when calling `cmake` so they are available in the form of `make <binary_test_name>` (i.e `make UNIT_gz_TEST`).

Note that this PR should go in sync with [the corresponding release-tools PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/325/adapt-gazebo-build-to-new-make-tests/diff) and [fixes to our install from source tutorial](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/382/remove-enable_tests_compilation-from/diff).

Testing runs:

  * [Ubuntu Linux](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/720/)
  * [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/746/)

content.raw:
Current PR status:

* Configure all testing targets by default so running `make <testing_target>` is always available.
* By default, running `make`or `make all` won't compile any single test
* To compile the tests run `make tests`
* To run tests `make test`
* Enabling the `BUILD_TESTING` cmake parameter (off by default) it will compile the tests just by running `make` or `make all`

Make the test target to depend on tests compilation (our tests target) is not possible, [this is on propose by design](http://public.kitware.com/Bug/view.php?id=8774). We could implement a `make check` (https://cmake.org/Wiki/CMakeEmulateMakeCheck) but not reuse the `test` target for the compile and run test suite.
content.html:
Current PR status:

  • Configure all testing targets by default so running make <testing_target> is always available.
  • By default, running makeor make all won't compile any single test
  • To compile the tests run make tests
  • To run tests make test
  • Enabling the BUILD_TESTING cmake parameter (off by default) it will compile the tests just by running make or make all

Make the test target to depend on tests compilation (our tests target) is not possible, this is on propose by design. We could implement a make check (https://cmake.org/Wiki/CMakeEmulateMakeCheck) but not reuse the test target for the compile and run test suite.

content.raw:
You can create the option yourself and make it false by default (to achieve the "don't pay for it if you don't use it" goal). And only conditionally include / use `CTest`.

I think the goal of disabling `BUILD_TESTING` at configure time is that you *don't* configure the test targets. So then you can't call the test targets with make.

The opposite (always configure the tests but don't build them by default) is already achieved with using `EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL` on the test targets.

content.raw: The standard way in CMake is using the CMake variable `BUILD_TESTING` to decide if the package should be configure with or without tests (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/module/CTest.html). Imo it would be good to follow that approach since it is known users familiar to CMake. SInce it defaults to `FALSE` it also ensures that "normal" users who just want to build but not test Gazebo will not "pay" for the involved overhead (test dependencies, configure time, unused make targets).

update.description:
The idea comes from @jlee02 explained in [a different pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2489/disable-tests-compilation-by-default-in/diff#comment-26266415). I'm point this change to default instead of gazebo7, seems pretty intrusive for me to include in a minor bump.

Remove the cmake `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` parameter and exclude all tests compilation from `make all` so a simple `make` call won't compile any single test file. 

The whole test suite can be compiled by running `make tests`. All the individual tests make targets are generated when calling `cmake` so they are available in the form of `make <binary_test_name>` (i.e `make UNIT_gz_TEST`).

Note that this PR should go in sync with [the corresponding release-tools PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/325/adapt-gazebo-build-to-new-make-tests/diff) and [fixes to our install from source tutorial](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/382/remove-enable_tests_compilation-from/diff).
